alert.note: Alert for Gratiot (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 6:02PM EDT until April 07 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Pine River at Alma affecting Gratiot County. .Over an inch of rain fell along sections of the river upstream from Alma on Wednesday. Runoff of the rain due to saturated soil is causing minor flooding along the river. For the Pine River...including Alma...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pine River at Alma. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.4 feet, Residences at junction of River and Downie Streets begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 PM EDT Wednesday was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.7 feet just after midnight, early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest is expected to be lower than the crest of 10.3 feet which occurred on May 19 2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
